intro: Pyrotis, commonly known as the flame violet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, resembling small flames. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Pyrotis is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
